heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 34.3mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: A significant windy period is on-going and is ranked 5th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 4 consecutive days beginning 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 296 m).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 295.8m lower than yesterday, 76.1m lower than the past week, 71.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 530m to a maximum of 1993m, averaging 715.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 791.1m and 786.4m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and little or no wind. Moderate rainfall, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (97%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
